review_blob: This is a SWEET ass beer! Not the best Kernel brew that Ive had but by no means a bad beer. Ive seen quite a few reviews here that have portrayed the beer more negatively than I think is fair - but it all comes down to personal preference I suppose. This beer does have a sickly sweetness to it and there are a lot of sweet fruits that yu pick up in both the aroma and taste (mangos, strawberries, etc.) but this beer is still a great IPA for an English brew..better than anything English that you could pick off the shelf at Tesco, put it that way! Not much carbonation at all which adds to that thick sweet and sickly taste..but a pretty awesome Double IPA in my books and well worth a chug!
beer_name: The Kernel India Pale Ale Double 4C

review_blob: Killer beer. Super well balance, awesome sweet malty aromas with an amazingly balanced sweet malty taste. Awesome beer.

Another great brew from Brooklyn. Not a huge fan of brown ales but theres so much to this beer in both the aroma and the taste. The aroma is super complex with a variety of malts used, giving off milk chocolate, caramel, and peanut scents with a floral hop character coming through. Jumping to the taste of the beer, roasted malts come through thick and fast and the taste pretty much follows the aroma with the hop bitterness coming in right at the back of the mouth after your mouth is washed with the roast malts, milk chocolate, peanut, and caramel flavours.

I could say a lot about this beer but let me just say its a pretty great brown ale with a lot of different flavours to pick out - Im sure different people will get lots of different things from this one!

A really solid East coast IPA. English hops and Malt but this doesnt taste too much like an English brew to me - still retains that East coast US style IPA (high ABV, heavily hopped, and a strong malt backbone).

A very solid beer from Brooklyn.

This is the worst beer that I have ever had..seriously, a terrible beer. Somehow holds its place (among other culprits) on supermarket shelves in the UK..but I guess that beers like this really make us appreciate great craft beer that much more!

Sorry Australia, but this is truly naff.

A truly great beer. One of the beers that first got me into drinking craft beers and a great step away from traditional lagers etc.

This was one of my first craft beers a while back and to this day I can remember that incredible aroma and mesmerising taste. After trying so many super-hopped IPAs in the last 18 months or so Id expect to appreciate this beer a little less nowadays..but I just had this again last week and it is still just as good as that very first day.

A superb pale ale.

Wow! A top beer from Kernel - where have they popped up from!?

This beer is something like youd expect to find if youd just walked along a palm edged street in California and stopped off at the nearest Tony Romas bar and grill...it really does ooze that Californian, west coast style. The taste is big on grapefruit and citrus, and oozes that great fruity bitterness.

Breweries like Kernel are so exciting for the UK craft brewing scene because they are offering us beers that we would only find the likes of in the USA and thats a great thing in the current beer climate because the US breweries are really brewing superb stuff. Another killer beer, Kernal!
beer_name: The Kernel India Pale Ale Cascade Centennial Chinook

review_blob: If anything comes close to the perfect beer then this is it, and this is coming from a hop head! I picked this beer up for the first time on a Friday night from a store 20 miles away from me and after tasting it that night I rushed back on the Saturday morning to make sure that I could pick up another couple of bottles before it went out of stock. A seriously fantastic beer..it really is a meal in a glass. If youve read some of my other reviews youll know that I dont like to go into too much detail as most of the time other reviewers have done that job for me..so let me just say that this beer really is worth seeking out as it does sit firmly (in my belief) as one of the very best stouts in the world. Great job Founders (again)!

Without going too much into the specifics, this is a great beer. Really well balanced in terms of taste. The aroma is really punchy and tropical, and to be honest the taste is anything but mixed up! Its a really well balanced IPA with a little bit of a difference, and that difference comes in the form of some tropical flavours from the hops and a strong English malt backbone. Definitely one to try!

The absolute quintessential west coast IPA. Need I say more? 

This beer is just incredible on the aroma, and right from the first smell you know exactly what youre going to get, and believe me when I say that the taste doesnt disappoint and only builds on that amazing aroma you just smelt seconds before taking your first sip.

Ive tried hundreds of IPAs, and this is without a doubt one of the very best that there is. Difficult to get hold of, but pick one up, try it, and enjoy!

This is a toughy guys..Im a big fan of the huge hoppy American beers, and Im a fan of your typical Belgian beers, but this one misses the mark for me and ends up a little confused. Reading the rest of the reviews of this beer here put me off commenting a little because Im really picking up a leafy/grassy kind of taste on the palate which nobody else seems to have really touched on too negatively..but for me theres a pungent kind of taste on the palate here with an almost off mint leaf taste on my palate. Dont get me wrong the beer starts well, and ends fairly crisp and pleasant, but somewhere in the middle its a little confused and pungent and I cant shake a strange rotten taste coming through. Aroma is fresh, crisp, and good, and it looks pretty good in the glass, but somewhere in the middle of the palate this beer goes a little wrong for me.
